name: The Sauce
description: The Sauce is a 60/40 sativa-dominant hybrid bred by Exotic Genetix. Using a backcross of Green Ribbon to pollenate a Gorilla Glue #4 mother, the Northwest breeder created a potent blend that emits a mix of chocolate, lime and diesel flavors. The Sauce took the prize for Judge’s Choice at the 2015 DOPE Cup in Seattle.
descriptionPlain: The Sauce is a 60/40 sativa-dominant hybrid bred by Exotic Genetix. Using a backcross of Green Ribbon to pollenate a Gorilla Glue #4 mother, the Northwest breeder created a potent blend that emits a mix of chocolate, lime and diesel flavors. The Sauce took the prize for Judge’s Choice at the 2015 DOPE Cup in Seattle.

highlightedReviews.text: I suffer from major everyday anxiety that will result in me having to walk away from my family/friends to try to chill my body and mind if I smoke a strain that induces too much of a cerebral high. I end up having an anxiety attack so bad that I can see my heart pumping outside of my shirt, I have terrible chest pains, and sometimes feel like I'm having a heart attack and might die. It sounds wildly dramatic, but...I. Bug. Out. I can't help it and I wish it wasn't this way. I have ptsd, depression, anxiety, and depersonalization disorder from childhood abuse/trauma. OH. MY. GOD. This strain is HEAVEN SENT FROM ABOVE!  I want to jump up and down and exclaim to the world how amazing The Sauce is. I'm happy, energetic, productive, and silly after smoking this. It's probably my absolute favorite. Seriously. If you suffer from staggering anxiety or ptsd, this is a must smoke! Hooray!

Where do I start? This strain is something special. It’s has a real uniqueness to it. A textbook sativa, but without any chance of the usual worries of paranoia. The smell is piney and citrusy, while the smoke is quite earthy, and chocolatey with notes of sour lime on the exhale. 
Now I’m not much of a sativa fan. I love my heavy hitting indica and very rarely even consider going with the orange instead of the purple. But my friend said I would be insane not to try it. And boy was he right. 
The smoke is super smooth, with hardly any urges to cough. The high hits very quick, but with a gentle touch too it. The clean buzz it provides has fends off all feelings of paranoia. Clear headed and very, VERY euphoric. After the head settles you feel a warm buzzing feeling of energy in your stomach, and before you know it you’re ass deep in the back of the fridge. 
I strongly recommend this to any and all consumers who suffer, or who have suffered in the past from paranoia, anxiety, stress and depression. It will alleviate all symptoms, while allowing you to remain clear and functional throughout the day. You won’t miss a beat, even after a whole joint! This one may just make it into the top ten! Definitely will be keeping this around for regular day time use. Get you some. Cheers

-BoaReviews

articles.title: 5 Excellent Funk Albums to Listen to While High
articles.author: Rae Lland
articles.text:
Originating in the 1960s, funk music was brought earthside by black American musicians who mixed rhythm, blues, soul, and jazz to give birth to a new genre of music that is as groovy as it is dance-inducing. Placing heavy emphasis on bass and drums, funk music is a distinctive genre that gets its name from the early etymology of the word, meaning “musty,” or “earthy.” Anyone who has watched a funk bassist get down knows the “stank face” all too well—it’s this pure, earth-driven vibe that gave funk its name and magnetic presence in the early scene.

There is truly no other genre like funk—a genre that can enliven, inspire, rejuvenate, and energize. It is a sound that is both euphoric and grounded. The following is a list of some suggested funk albums to get the bones shaking and heart pumping, best enjoyed with some happy, sativa-dominant strains. Have your own funk albums you love to listen to while high? Tell us all about them in the comments below!
Mothership Connection by Parliament-Funkadelic

Strain Pairing Recommendation: Funfetti
“Funk not only moves, it can remove,” go the intro lyrics in this delightfully stanky, purely funky iconic album by Parliament-Funkadelic. Led by singer-songwriter George Clinton, whose fresh sound sparked its own genre title known as “P-funk,” Parliament-Funkadelic’s vibe is quintessentially funk, and thus impossible not to groove to. Mothership Connection is an album that plays out like a performance: It begins with a lively introduction, like the opening act to a play, and then dives deep into a medley of groovy bass lines and Clinton’s seamless vocals. Mothership Connection is a collection of pure funk sound that will have the listener looking up, getting up, and feeling up—particularly in conjunction with the lively strain Funfetti.
Fugue State by Vulfpeck

Strain Pairing Recommendation: Monkey Paw
If you haven’t heard of Vulfpeck yet, get ready to join the vulfpack. The American funk group with an imaginary German flair have been steadily taking the music scene by storm since they were founded in 2011. Fugue State, released in 2014, is one of their most popular albums despite containing only six songs and lasting about 18 minutes. While mostly instrumental, Vulfpeck does at times feature vocals such as those on the track “1612,” a thoroughly catchy offering.
Despite its short playlist, Fugue State is not lacking in sound or diversity; and perhaps diversity of sound is what Vulfpeck does best. Each song, even each album, builds a distinctive vibe that somehow manages to be both modern and original while also maintaining a nostalgic and vintage je ne sais quoi.
Beyond The Sun by Orgone

Strain Pairing Recommendation: Lemon Bubble
Orgone’s Beyond The Sun is a venerable pleasure from the first note to the last. The music is playful, fierce, and lively, with the powerful vocals of singer Fanny Franklin driving the sound like any of the best conductors. Although much of their music is instrumental, Beyond The Sun especially highlights Franklin’s impeccable tone. However, make no mistake—as riveting as Franklin’s voice may be, instrumentalists are not outmatched but rather perfectly paired, creating a delicious confection of funk for the cannabis-elevated ears to enjoy. This is an album that will delight and invigorate while encouraging participation through song and dance.

Next by Soulive

Strain Pairing Recommendation: The Sauce
Originating in the forever famous Woodstock, NY, Soulive is a jazz-funk trio that brings the sounds of soul, R&B, rock, and jazz to their largely instrumental recordings. Soulive is certainly a jazzier take on funk, with Eric Krasno on guitar, Alan Evans on drums and Neal Evans on keys, organ, and clarinet. At times, it’s easy to forget Soulive is a trio with their sound so rich and full. Their album Next, released in 2002, adds saxophonist Sam Kininger to the mix, providing an extra depth to their already wildly intricate sound. The album invites the herbally enraptured listener to go on a smooth ride through funky highs and soulful lows, which wind together a sprinkle of vocals amongst a sea of invigorating instrumentals.
Rowdy Duty by Deep Banana Blackout

Strain Pairing Recommendation: Banana Diesel  
Punchy and powerful, Deep Banana Blackout’s live album Rowdy Duty transports the listener to a live funk show filled with delightful improvisation, stimulating instrumentals, and robust vocals. Recorded in a single night, the 13-track album truly encapsulates the band’s jazz-funk, New Orleans-style sound. The eight-piece ensemble includes a full horn section, creating a funk experience that is truly dynamic and full. All together, it’s an energetic funk soundscape that will lead the blissed-out listener through a maze of funky highs and spacey lows.

Funk music is a music of joy that moves people physically as well as uplifting them mentally. It is perhaps one of the most distinctive genres and one of the most original to come out of the golden era of music in the 1960s. Funk enlivens, and listening to it is simply good for the soul. At the end of the day, funk is all about happiness.

articles.title: The 2015 DOPE Cup Winning Cannabis Strains, Concentrates, and Edibles
articles.author: Will Hyde
articles.text:
Over the 420 holiday weekend, DOPE Magazine celebrated their 4th annual DOPE Cup at 7-Point Studios in Seattle. The celebration was sponsored by Leafly and showcased some of the region’s best cannabis flower, concentrates, edibles, topicals, glass artists, and accessories. Even a last-minute venue change couldn’t stop the stream of cannabis lovers from overflowing the state fair-themed event that came complete with infused cotton candy, a mechanical joint to ride, magicians, performers, artists, and more. Honestly, the only thing missing was a medicated corn dog to combat my munchies.
As expected, the dab bar was the hive that everyone was buzzing around, with a variety of solvent and solventless concentrates to sample from some of the best extract artists in the area. The highlight had to be local artist Scott Deppe’s crystal skull piece that sat at the X-Tracted bar and captured every passer-by with its intricate design and whopping 6-figure price tag. Those who weren’t concentrated around the dab rigs were busy sampling edibles, entering raffles, and relaxing with a massage at one the topical company booths.

A judge’s pass to the event allowed visitors to join the action by sampling each of the strains entered into the People's Choice category of the Cup. For $99, the judge’s pass gave ticket-holders a half gram sample of all 10 anonymous strains and the opportunity to vote for their favorite. The mystery strains all had amazing flavors, ranging from sweet and tropical to earthy and piney, which made it all the more difficult to choose a favorite.

So, without further ado, here are the DOPE Cup winners!
 
Flower Winners

 
People's Choice Flower

Winner: CPC or Cotton Purple Chem by Hesperides Gardens (Strain #4)
 
Judges' Choice Flower

Winner: The Sauce by ExoticGenetix (Strain #6)
 
Best Indica

Winner: Cascadia Kush by Hesperides Gardens
Runner Up: The White from Cannabis Club by Freak UV Nature
 
Best Sativa

Winner: Matanuska Thunder Fuck by TJ's Gardens
Runner Up: Head Cheese from Cali Connection
 
Best Hybrid

Winner: Peppermint Cookies by GoldLeaf Gardens
Runner Up: GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies) by Rain City Cannabis & Top Shelf
 
Highest THC

Winner: The White (29.9%) by Solstice
Runner Up: DT-13 (28.7%) by Patient 99 Care
 
Highest CBD

Winner: ACDC (18.05%) by Loaded Soda
Runner Up: ACDC x Charlotte's Web (17.02%) by B-EZ and Fweedom
 
Concentrate Winners

 
Best BHO – THC
Winner: Marmalade (94.36%) from Platinum Extracts
Runner Up: Private Reserve OG (83.73%) from The Bakeréé
 
Best BHO – CBD

Winner: Sour Tsunami (83.7%) from Solstice by Refine
Runner Up: Sour Tsunami (74.08%) by Stoney Extracts
 
Best CO2 – THC
Winner: Mixed Berry (48.56%, 110 ppm) by Evergreen Extracts
Runner Up: Death Star (69.09%, <10 ppm) by Happy Cats – CO2 Organics
 
Best CO2 – CBD

Winner: ACDC x Remedy (78% CBD, <10 ppm) by Loaded Soda – CO2 Organics
Runner Up: Evergreen Extracts (42.81% CBD, <10 ppm)
 
Best Non-Solvent – THC

Winner: Kimbo Kush (84.37%, dry sift) Cuban Tech from Exotic Genetics
Runner Up: Fire On the Mountain (82.68%) from NW Alchemy featuring Head Hunter
 
Best Non-Solvent – CBD

Winner: Remedy (52.5% CBD, 3390 ppm ethanol) by Hesperides Gardens
Runner Up: ACDC (13.41% CBD bubble hash) Loaded Soda by CO2 Organics
 
Edible Winners

 
Best Edible – Savory
Winner: Delux Nut Mix by Laurie and Marry Jane
Runner Up: Capitol Hill Peanut Butter
 
Best Edible – Sweet
Winner: Dark Chocolate Fudge by Mad Monster
Runner Up: Almond Bites by Laurie and Marry Jane
 
Best Edible – Drink
Winner: Loaded Soda Root Beer – 104.85 mg THC
Runner Up: Sensi Sweet Tropical Punch – 58.68 mg THC
 
Best Edible – CBD
Winner: Vanilla Truffles from The Bakeree – Cookie Fam Genetics
Runner Up: Slips by Oakor
 
Best Topical
Winner: Kush Cream Cherry Bomb – 2.01 mg THC
Runner Up: Liberty Lotion High CBD – 1.67 mg CBD

growInfo.growNotes:
Notes from ExoticGenetix:


	Mother: Gorilla Glue #4
	Father: Green Ribbon BX
	Family: 60/40 Sativa
	Sex: Reg
	Growing Conditions: Multi-topped Bush
	Height: Medium/Tall
	Flowering Time: 56-63 Dyas
	Yield: Heavy Producer
	Aroma: Lime Chocolate Gas
	THC: 28%
